entry.string: What is it?
The Headlines module allows you to syndicate content from other website. It also allows you to use predetermined hooks from Xaraya if you have them installed and activated.
entry.translation: Das Schlagzeilen-Modul erlaubt die Syndikation des Inhalts anderer Websites. Ebenso ermöglicht es den Einsatz vorbestimmter Hooks von Xaraya, wenn diese installiert und aktiviert sind.

entry.string: How to use it?
From the menu, you have three choices:
Add Headlines: Add a new syndication headline for processing.
Manage Headlines: View, edit and delete headlines that you have added to your site. Add alternative titles and headlines for your feeds, and order the display of the feeds
Modify Configuration: Update the global configuration for the module. Here you can set
the number of feeds per page
optionally select an Article module publication type to import the feed items. You will need a title and summary field in your publication type to import feed items.
choose which content to import to your selected publication type. Feed, Title, Description and an optional link to the originating feed item can also be added in your publication type summary field.
Hook the Categories module to Headlines to classify your feeds by category on display.
Included Blocks
RSS Block allows you to provide selected feeds in blocks on your siten and define number of items, title, and refresh times.
Cloud Block Creates a cloud block from blog feeds, using Ping module to notify of updates and Scheduler module to update.
Included Hooks
There are no included hooks with Headlines
Credits
The RSS Block is using
PHP feedParser
as its backend. The notes for the feedParser by Reverend Jim are as follows
entry.translation: als Backend. DIE Anmerkungen zum FeedParser von Reverend Jim sind wie folgt

entry.string: feedParser was created due to the lack of a good, flexible, class-based RSS feed parser for PHP. It has been built as a class, and currently handles RSS 0.91, RSS 0.92, RSS 0.93, RSS 1.0, and RSS 2.0 feeds. For channels it grabs the title, description, link, and creator. For items it grabs the title, description, link, and date. It also provides a form of the date converted into the local timezone to facilitate cronological sorting of items. The dates are provided in UNIX timestamp format for easy manipulation by other PHP functions.
entry.translation: Der Feed-Parser wurde aufgrund des Mangels an einem guten, flexiblen, klassenbasierten RSS Feed-Parser für PHP erstellt. Er ist als eine Klasse aufgebaut worden und bearbeitet gegenwärtig RSS 0,91, RSS 0,92, RSS 0,93, RSS 1,0 und RSS 2,0 Feeds. Für Channels verwendet er den Titel, die Beschreibung, den Link und den Ersteller. Für Elemente verwendet er den Titel, die Beschreibung, den Link und das Datum. Es liefert auch eine Form des Datums, das in die örtliche Zeitzone umgewandelt wird, um die zeitliche Sortierung von Elementen zu erleichtern. Die Daten werden im UNIX-Timestamp-Format geliefert, um die leichtere Bearbeitung seitens anderer PHP-Funktionen zu ermöglichen.
